website_summaries.verdict: Uses a heavy-gauge aluminum in the construction to provide plenty of strength.
pros: Ships with a 1.5-inch hook to secure the bunk ladder in place
Steps are wrapped in nylon pads to help with comfort when walking on them with bare feet
Provides a sturdier means of climbing than most bunk ladders, especially if you're carrying something heavy
cons: Expensive for a bunk ladder that only provides 60-inches of height

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy ladder
customer_reviews.text: Really nice ladder. I bought one so my teen-age daughter could climb up to her elevated bed. It has soft rubber treads on the steps--probably more intended for climbing with shoes, but not uncomfortable in bare feet. The ladder is sturdy and the steps are a reasonable distance apart. The legs have rubber caps to keep from marring the floor and hooks at the top to hang onto the bed frame (or where ever you choose to hand it). Serves its purpose. I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: An enthusiast of life

customer_reviews.title: wrong item sent
customer_reviews.text: can i give this zero stars? the item i received looks like it was pulled from a junkyard. i don't even know what it can be used for...it is a huge, hollow, container of some kind...it's metal, and all dented. it really looks like it was sent as some kind of joke. so annoyed. and it's really heavy. i have to have ups come back and pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: princetonmom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camp trailer bunk
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a bunk bed in a new camp trailer. We had to cut the legs down several inches so that the height was correct for our bunk but that was easily done with a small hand saw. It's been perfect for our 3 and 4 year olds to get into and out of the top bunk with little to no difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: COmommyX2

customer_reviews.title: Fits great for a loft bed
customer_reviews.text: I bought a loft bed that had a built in rod ladder that isn't comfortable on the feet and purchased the 60" ladder on a recommendation. It is perfect with the steps that are covered with rubber to keep from slipping and not so hard when trying to climb down on the feet. I may have bought the 66" if I wanted it to stick out away from the loft bed a little further but this length works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Koenig

customer_reviews.title: Good ladder for RV bunks
customer_reviews.text: This works great for the top bunk in my toy hauler. If you're unsure of the height, recommend taking a measurement first. The hooks are perfect for RV bunks and it has rubber padding on the steps, so you can use it barefoot. Made of lightweight aluminum. You might want to find one made of steel if you're a fatty.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Handy - light ladder for RV
customer_reviews.text: This is so light and handy in our RV. May need to saw off about 5 inches to fit better on height where it's located. I'm quite happy with the quality of the ladder. I have Prime, so it came within 2-3 days.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Webb

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use in our camper and it has been a life saver! I ordered the wrong size (forgot to measure) so we just cut it down to size easily and it works perfect! Very sturdy and the children (and adults) have no problem using it :-)
customer_reviews.author: Nicky

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kids' Bunk/Loft Bed, too!
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT! We needed a replacement ladder for one of our boys' loft beds. This one fit perfectly! It is light weight, yet very sturdy. It can handle busy teens as well as heavier Mom and Dad ;)

customer_reviews.title: The ladder itself is good. Seems sturdy enough to hold weight
customer_reviews.text: The ladder itself is good. Seems sturdy enough to hold weight. The only problem I have is how to attach it to the bunk. The only places on the bunk that have a "lip" to hold the top hooks are either by the steps so the ladder doesn't have a solid floor to rest on or on the side where the table and bench are in the way so there is no room for the ladder. I haven't tried to use it yet so I'll have to wait and see how it works out.
customer_reviews.author: Jo S.

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder - the rubber feet helps it stay in ...
customer_reviews.text: Great ladder - the rubber feet helps it stay in place in our RV bunks. The hooks on the top a bit awkward - but they work. Light weight yet durable and stable enough for a grown man to use if need be.

customer_reviews.title: nice ladder!

customer_reviews.title: Bunk house ladder
customer_reviews.text: This bunk house ladder meets our expectations. It holds up very well with our daughter (weighing around 140). Other than that, we have had no problems with the ladder. I would recommend it.
